messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Good adaptations
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/2/03 4:22:17 PM, diamondair@email.msn.com writes:  Mine to, sorta,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/2/03 4:22:17 PM, diamondair@... writes:

<< The Shawshank Redemption (on my top ten all time favorites

list) >>

Mine to, sorta, it's actually in my top five. I'm not one for watching movies
over and over. If I ***really*** like a movie, I'll go for a second round.
Shawshank, watched again just a few weeks ago, for probably the 15th time.
Lara.............

messages.subject: Good adaptations
messages.msgSnippet: ... Stand By Me, The Shawshank Redemption (on my top ten all time favorites list) and The Green Mile. All from stories or books by Stephen King. None of them
messages.messageBody:
> Can we start a list of GOOD
>
> adaptations??

Stand By Me, The Shawshank Redemption (on my top ten all time favorites
list) and The Green Mile. All from stories or books by Stephen King. None of
them really "horror" (I'm not a fan of the movies made from his horror
books, ala Christine).

Blue Skies!
-Robin-
